text: Jean-Maurice-Émile Baudot (11 September 1845 – 28 March 1903) was a French engineer and inventor. He was one of the first people to work in telecommunications. The baud, a type of measurement, was named after him. Category:1845 births Category:1903 deaths Category:French engineers Category:French inventors Category:Electrical engineers Category:Telegraphy
title: Émile Baudot
